channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: National Day of Colombia
item.description:
Sunday, 20 July 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Red, Blue and Yellow to celebrate National Day of Colombia

The Commemoration of the Colombian National Day holds great significance for the Colombian community, as it marked a turning point in the struggle for independence and became a defining moment in the birth of the Colombian Nation. By celebrating this we wish to recognize the Colombian community in Brisbane, a vibrant, inclusive and prosperous city which many of our nationals call home.

This Light Up is organised by: Embassy of the Republic of Colombia

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Eve of World Fragile X Day
item.description:
Monday, 21 July 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Orange to support Eve of World Fragile X Day

The annual lightup program for World Fragile X Day is a special event for the Australian Fragile X community. Starting in Brisbane 10 years ago, and growing stronger each year! The Day is celebrated in many countries, with the aim to raise awareness of Fragile X syndrome and its related conditions (it is the leading cause of inherited intellectual disability and developmental delay, with links to autism), and to promote support and inclusion for those affected and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Fragile X Association of Australia Inc

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: National Pyjama Day
item.description:
Tuesday, 22 July 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support National Pyjama Day

The Pyjama Foundation supports the educational outcomes for children in foster care through The Love of Learning Program. Volunteers, known as Pyjama Angels, spend time with children in care once a week reading books aloud, playing educational games and engaging in fun learning-based activities. Most importantly, a Pyjama Angels role is to provide consistent friendship and support for the child, teaching them that they are valued. National Pyjama Day (officially held on Friday 25 July 2025) raises awareness and funds for The Pyjama Foundation's Love of Learning Program, supporting the educational outcomes of children in care.

This Light Up is organised by: The Pyjama Foundation Ltd

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: 7 Years to Brisbane 2032 Olympic Games
item.description:
Wednesday, 23 July 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Olympic Colours to celebrate 7 Years to Brisbane 2032 Olympic Games

23 July 2025 marks 7 years to the start of the Brisbane 2032 Olympic Games. The Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games will create a legacy that aligns with Council’s commitment to making the Brisbane of tomorrow even better than the Brisbane of today.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

item.title: Eve of World Drowning Prevention Day
item.description:
Thursday, 24 July 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support the Eve of World Drowning Prevention Day

On Friday 25 July 2025, landmarks across Australia turn blue to both remember those who have been lost to drowning, and as a reminder that anyone can drown, but no one should. Drowning does not discriminate; whether you are eight months old or eighty, living in a capital city or a country town, drowning is a significant risk. World Drowning Prevention Day is a chance for everyone to reflect on what they can do to promote water safety.

This Light Up is organised by: Royal Life Saving Society

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: 2025 Queensland Training Awards
item.description:
Friday, 25 July 2025

City Hall will be lit Blue to support 2025 Queensland Training Awards

Event taking place in City Hall

This Light Up is organised by: The Department of Trade, Employment and Training

item.title: Strive to be Kind Day
item.description:
Friday, 25 July 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Yellow to support Strive to be Kind Day

Strive To Be Kind Day which is hosted by The Allison Baden-Clay Foundation. This day is the culmination of our Strive To Be Kind month which aims to celebrate and honour the life of Allison Baden-Clay and bring awareness about domestic and family violence and coercive control. The Strive To Be Kind Day raises funds for the development of programs to educate and empower the community to recognise the signs of coercive control and domestic abuse.

This Light Up is organised by: The Allison Baden-Clay Foundation

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Golden Jubilee Celebration – Vietnamese Community in Australia Queensland Chapter
item.description:
Saturday, 26 July 2025

City Hall will be lit Blue and Yellow to celebrate the Golden Jubilee Celebration – Vietnamese Community in Australia Queensland Chapter

Celebrate the resilience, achievements and contributions of the Vietnamese community in Brisbane, a shining example of the city’s value of multiculturalism.

This Light Up is organised by: Vietnamese Community in Australia Queensland Chapter

item.title: Gambling Harm Awareness Week
item.description:
Sunday, 27 July 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Green to support Gambling Harm Awareness Week

Relationships Australia Qld is the predominate deliverer of Gambling Help service in Queensland and is tasked each year to deliver the state launch of Gambling Harm Awareness Week in Brisbane. A portion of our community experience gambling harm and in turn so does the family and supports. This week is to raise awareness to those experiencing harms that help is available.

This Light Up is organised by: Relationships Australia Qld

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

This Light Up is organised by: Relationships Australia Qld

This Light Up is organised by: Consulate of Peru

item.title: World Hepatitis Day
item.description:
Monday, 28 July 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Green to support World Hepatitis Day

Hepatitis Queensland is a values-driven and innovative community organisation that strives to improve the lives of Queenslanders affected by viral hepatitis and liver disease via education, collaboration, and person-centred care initiatives. Our mission is to enable all Queenslanders to live free from the impact of viral hepatitis and liver disease. World Hepatitis Day falls on July 28 each year and is part of a global initiative established by the World Hepatitis Alliance. World Hepatitis Day aims to raise awareness of viral hepatitis and encourage prevention, testing, treatment, and management.

This Light Up is organised by: Hepatitis Queensland

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

World Hepatitis Day falls on July 28 each year and is part of a global initiative established by the World Hepatitis Alliance. World Hepatitis Day aims to raise awareness of viral hepatitis and encourage prevention, testing, treatment, and management.
This Light Up is organised by: Hepatitis Queensland

item.title: DonateLife Week
item.description:
Tuesday, 29 July 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Magenta to support DonateLife Week

DonateLife aims to save the lives of the 1800 patients waitlisted for an organ transplant by encouraging more Australians to sign up as organ and tissue donors and talk to their families. The annual national DonateLife Week encourages Australians to register as organ and tissue donors, helping DonateLife save the lives of those on the transplant waitlist. DonateLife Qld runs events throughout this week.

This Light Up is organised by: Metro Health South

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

DonateLife Qld runs events throughout this week.
This Light Up is organised by: Metro Health South

item.title: Eve of World Ranger Day
item.description:
Wednesday, 30 July 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Green to support the Eve of World Ranger Day

Queensland Ranger Association connects people working in protected area management (National Parks) and wildlife conservation (rangers, wildlife rangers) across Queensland. We provide networking, upskilling and sponsorship to various events nationally and internationally. We raise awareness for fallen Rangers in Oceania and supported by global foundations, like the Thin Green Line and International Ranger Federation. We have members from Department of Environment, Great Barrier Reef Authority, local land councils as well as First Nations Land & Sea Ranger Organisations. The annual World Ranger Day on July 31st raises awareness each year to reflect on sacrifices and lives lost by rangers around the world, and Australia. It is also a day to celebrate the incredible work that rangers, wildlife rangers do in national parks and with biodiversity conservation to protect Queensland and the world's natural treasures and cultural heritage.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Ranger Association

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

We raise awareness for fallen Rangers in Oceania and supported by global foundations, like the Thin Green Line and International Ranger Federation. We have members from Department of Environment, Great Barrier Reef Authority, local land councils as well as First Nations Land & Sea Ranger Organisations. The annual World Ranger Day on July 31st raises awareness each year to reflect on sacrifices and lives lost by rangers around the world, and Australia. It is also a day to celebrate the incredible work that rangers, wildlife rangers do in national parks and with biodiversity conservation to protect Queensland and the world's natural treasures and cultural heritage.
This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Ranger Association

Wednesday, 30 July 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Green to support the Eve of World Ranger Day

Queensland Ranger Association connects people working in protected area management (National Parks) and wildlife conservation (rangers, wildlife rangers) across Queensland. We provide networking, upskilling and sponsorship to various events nationally and internationally. We raise awareness for fallen Rangers in Oceania and supported by global foundations, like the Thin Green Line and International Ranger Federation. We have members from Department of Environment, Great Barrier Reef Authority, local land councils as well as First Nations Land & Sea Ranger Organisations. The annual World Ranger Day on July 31st raises awareness each year to reflect on sacrifices and lives lost by rangers around the world, and Australia. It is also a day to celebrate the incredible work that rangers, wildlife rangers do in national parks and with biodiversity conservation to protect Queensland and the world's natural treasures and cultural heritage.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Ranger Association

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Rural Fire Service Queensland Week
item.description:
Thursday, 31 July 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support Rural Fire Service Queensland Week

Rural Fire Service Queensland (RFSQ) has a state-wide volunteer workforce comprised of dedicated people who are ready to support their communities when needed. RFSQ Week 2025 will commence from Sunday, 27 July to Saturday, 2 August and will highlight the dedication and commitment of RFSQ volunteer members. Rural Fire Service Queensland Week is a state-wide celebration held each year in recognition of the critical and invaluable role volunteer members perform in emergency service delivery in Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Rural Fire Service Queensland

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
